main event: Military personnel at Holloman Air Force Base observed a luminous cigar-shaped object in the sky for approximately 44 minutes on 19 February 1950.
interesting points: The object was first seen on the horizon and moved steadily at a 45-degree angle,The witnesses described the object changing shape and color over time,At one point, the object appeared to take the shape of an ice-cream cone,Despite checks with local weather stations, no other explanations for the sighting were identified,The object eventually diminished in size until it was no longer visible.
location: Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico, USA
witness description: Air Force personnel including Major William J. Haynor and West William S. Royal
